quality_assessment: Documentation is well-structured and accurate in describing Rust-only support (per spec 191), but contains outdated source line references that no longer match the current codebase

issues.description: Source reference 'src/core/mod.rs:376-377' is incorrect. The Language enum and Rust-only support documentation is at different lines.
issues.current_content: **Source**: As documented in src/core/mod.rs:376-377 and src/core/injection.rs:198-200
issues.should_be: **Source**: Language enum at src/core/mod.rs:416-421, AnalyzerFactory at src/core/injection.rs:190-203
issues.fix_suggestion: Update source reference to use correct line numbers

issues.description: Source reference 'src/core/mod.rs:386-391' for Language detection from_path function is incorrect. The actual from_path function is at lines 435-440.
Source reference 'src/core/mod.rs:368-372' for Language enum is incorrect. The actual Language enum is at lines 416-421.
Source reference 'src/core/mod.rs:375-391' is outdated. The actual implementation spans lines 423-440.
Source reference 'src/analyzers/mod.rs:39-43' is slightly off. The actual Analyzer trait is at lines 40-44.
Multiple line references in the 'Adding Language Support' steps are outdated
issues.should_be: Language enum at 416-421, from_extension at 423-433, AnalyzerFactory at 190-203
issues.fix_suggestion: Update all line references in this section to match current source code locations

positive_aspects: Accurate and clear description of Rust-only analysis focus per specification 191
Correctly explains Python as an 'Architectural placeholder, not supported'
Clear explanation of the Analyzer trait interface and its purpose
Good code examples showing Language enum and from_path implementation that match actual code
Comprehensive coverage of semantic function classification categories
Well-organized extensibility section for future language additions
Valid internal links to related documentation (overview.md, complexity-metrics.md, risk-scoring.md)
Clear usage examples demonstrating debtmap CLI commands
Helpful note distinguishing between two Analyzer traits in the codebase
improvement_suggestions: Update all source line references to match current codebase (approximately 48-line offset shift)
Consider removing line number references in favor of function/type names only, as line numbers drift frequently
Add note about the core/types.rs Language enum which also exists alongside core/mod.rs version

metadata.validation_focus: Check analyzer type documentation is current
previous_issues_resolved: Python/JavaScript/TypeScript references - documentation now correctly states Rust-only
Contradictory 'Unsupported Languages' section - documentation now consistent
